title: Denys Shmyhal - Wikipedia
snippet: As Prime Minister, Shmyhal was ... a day after President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced a government reshuffle and proposed replacing Shmyhal with Yulia Svyrydenko as prime minister....

title: Prime Minister of Ukraine - Wikipedia
snippet: The current prime minister is Yulia Svyrydenko, who was confirmed by the Verkhovna Rada on 17 July 2025. She replaced Denys Shmyhal, who had been sworn in on 4 March 2020 following the resignation of Oleksiy Honcharuk.

title: Ukrainian PM Resigns Amid Major Government Reshuffle
snippet: He posted a photograph of Shmyhal's handwritten resignation letter on July 15. Shmyhal’s replacement will be Yulia Svyrydenko, who has been serving as first deputy prime minister.

title: Shmyhal Government - Wikipedia
snippet: On 16 July 2021 Denys Monastyrsky was appointed Avakov's successor. Following his January 2023 death in a helicopter crash, Monastyrsky was succeeded by Ihor Klymenko on 7 February 2023.

title: Individuals Over Institutions: Ukraine’s Government Reshuffle | Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
snippet: Just this summer, many anticipated that Yulia Svyrydenko—the first deputy prime minister and economic development and trade minister, who is close to Yermak—would take Shmyhal’s place, only for him to cling on.
